name: julius-caesar
description: Roman senators assassinated Caesar on the Ides of March.

name: hitler-power
description: Adolf Hitler was appointed Chancellor of Germany.

name: jfk-assassination
description: President John F. Kennedy was assassinated in Dallas, Texas.

name: watergate
description: The break-in and cover-up that led to Nixon's resignation.

name: obama-elected
description: Barack Obama became the first Black president of the United States.

name: democracy-athens
description: Cleisthenes introduced democratic reforms in Athens.

name: declaration-independence
description: The American colonies declared independence from Britain.

name: slavery-abolished
description: The 13th Amendment abolished slavery in the United States.

name: gettysburg
description: Lincoln delivered his famous speech during the Civil War.

name: india-independence
description: India gained independence from British colonial rule.

name: berlin-wall
description: The fall of the Berlin Wall symbolized the end of the Cold War.

name: soviet-collapse
description: The dissolution of the USSR ended the Cold War era.

name: apartheid-end
description: Nelson Mandela became South Africa's first Black president.

name: hammurabi
description: One of the earliest written legal codes was established in Babylon.

name: magna-carta
description: King John signed the charter limiting royal power.

name: charlemagne
description: Charlemagne was crowned Holy Roman Emperor by the Pope.
